column1: Viral gastroenteritis is swelling or inflammation of the stomach and intestines from a virus.
The infection can lead to diarrhea and vomiting.
Gastroenteritis can affect one person or a group of people who all ate the same food or drank the same water.
Viral gastroenteritis is a leading cause of severe diarrhea in both adults and children.
- Rotavirus is the leading cause of severe gastroenteritis in children.
